wikipedia_page.main: John Clement Carruthers (1900–1959) was an English professional footballer. A centre forward born in Howden-on-Tyne, he played in the Football League for South Shields, Bradford City, Blackpool and Crewe Alexandra, in between spells with Preston Colliery.

link_mentions.page: List of Bradford City A.F.C. players (1–49 league appearances)

response: * John Carruthers (politician) (1863–1949), member of the Canadian House of Commons
* John Carruthers (engineer) (1836–1914), New Zealand engineer and economic theorist
* John Carruthers (surveyor) (1847–1942), pioneer of South Australia
